title: Todo Application
short: A task management app with local storage functionality
description: A fully functional todo application built with vanilla JavaScript. Features include adding, editing, deleting tasks, marking as complete, filtering by status, and persistent storage using localStorage. The app demonstrates CRUD operations and modern JavaScript ES6+ features.
features: Add, edit, and delete tasks with ease
Mark tasks as completed with visual feedback
Filter tasks by all, active, or completed status
Persistent storage using browser localStorage
Responsive design works on all devices
Clean and intuitive user interface
challenges: The main challenge was implementing efficient localStorage management and ensuring data persistence across browser sessions. I learned about proper data serialization and handling edge cases.

title: Weather Dashboard
short: Real-time weather information using OpenWeather API
description: An interactive weather dashboard that provides real-time weather data for any city worldwide. Built with vanilla JavaScript and integrated with the OpenWeather API to fetch current conditions, 5-day forecasts, and weather alerts. Features a clean, modern UI with weather icons and temperature animations.
features: Search weather by city name or coordinates
Display current temperature, humidity, and wind speed
5-day weather forecast with detailed information
Dynamic background changes based on weather conditions
Geolocation support for automatic location detection
Temperature unit conversion (Celsius/Fahrenheit)
challenges: Working with asynchronous API calls and handling various error states was challenging. I implemented proper error handling and loading states to improve user experience.

title: Portfolio Website
short: Personal portfolio showcasing projects and skills
description: A modern, responsive portfolio website built with Node.js and EJS templating. Features smooth animations, dark/light mode toggle, interactive cursor effects, and a project carousel. The site showcases my web development skills and provides an engaging user experience.
features: Responsive design optimized for all screen sizes
Dark and light mode with smooth transitions
Interactive cursor trail effects
Animated loading screen with progress indicator
Project carousel with keyboard navigation
Contact form with Web3Forms integration
challenges: Creating smooth animations and ensuring performance across different devices required careful optimization. I learned about CSS transforms, requestAnimationFrame, and efficient DOM manipulation.

title: E-Commerce Store
short: Online shopping platform with cart functionality
description: A fully functional e-commerce website featuring product listings, shopping cart, checkout process, and order management. Built with React and integrated with a mock API for product data. Includes search, filtering, sorting capabilities, and a responsive design.
features: Product catalog with detailed product pages
Shopping cart with add/remove/update quantities
Product search and advanced filtering
Sort by price, popularity, and ratings
Responsive design for mobile shopping
Checkout process with form validation
challenges: Managing complex state across multiple components and implementing the shopping cart logic was challenging. I learned about React Context API and proper state management patterns.

title: Recipe Finder
description: An interactive recipe finder application that helps users discover new recipes based on ingredients, dietary preferences, and cuisine types. Integrated with Spoonacular API to provide detailed recipe information, nutritional data, and cooking instructions.
features: Search recipes by ingredients or name
Filter by dietary restrictions and cuisines
View detailed recipe information and instructions
Save favorite recipes to local storage
Nutritional information display
Random recipe suggestion feature
challenges: Handling API rate limits and implementing efficient caching strategies was important. I learned about debouncing search inputs and optimizing API calls to improve performance.

title: Quiz Application
short: Interactive quiz game with multiple categories
description: An engaging quiz application featuring multiple categories, difficulty levels, and a scoring system. Built with vanilla JavaScript using the Open Trivia Database API. Includes timer functionality, score tracking, and result analysis with visual feedback.
features: Multiple quiz categories and difficulty levels
Timer functionality for each question
Real-time score tracking and display
Visual feedback for correct/incorrect answers
Results summary with performance analysis
Restart and category selection options
challenges: Implementing the timer logic and ensuring accurate score calculation required careful state management. I learned about setInterval, clearInterval, and proper cleanup of event listeners.

title: Expense Tracker
short: Track income and expenses with visual charts
description: A personal finance tracker that helps users manage their income and expenses. Features include adding transactions, categorizing expenses, viewing balance summaries, and visualizing spending patterns with charts. Data is stored locally for privacy.
features: Add, edit, and delete income/expense transactions
Categorize transactions with custom categories
Visual charts showing spending patterns
Calculate and display current balance
Filter transactions by date range
Export data as CSV for backup
challenges: Integrating Chart.js library and creating meaningful visualizations from transaction data was a learning experience. I gained skills in data manipulation and chart customization.

title: Movie Search Engine
short: Search and explore movies using TMDb API
description: A movie discovery platform that allows users to search for movies, view detailed information, watch trailers, and save favorites. Integrated with The Movie Database (TMDb) API to fetch movie data, ratings, cast information, and poster images.
features: Search movies by title with autocomplete
View detailed movie information and trailers
Browse popular, top-rated, and upcoming movies
Save favorite movies to local storage
Responsive grid layout with poster images
Filter by genre and release year
challenges: Handling large amounts of image data and implementing lazy loading for better performance was crucial. I learned about intersection observer API and image optimization techniques.

title: Note Taking App
description: A minimalist note-taking application with markdown support, tags, and search functionality. Built with vanilla JavaScript and designed for quick note capture and organization. Features include auto-save, note categorization, and a clean, distraction-free interface.
features: Create, edit, and delete notes instantly
Markdown support for rich text formatting
Tag notes for better organization
Full-text search across all notes
Auto-save functionality prevents data loss
Dark mode for comfortable writing
challenges: Implementing markdown parsing and rendering required understanding of regex and string manipulation. I also learned about contenteditable attributes and handling user input securely.
